abstract.text: Returns a new input to append sample buffers of the specified type to the output file.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The media type of the samples the input accepts.
The settings to use for encoding the media you append to the output. Create an output settings dictionary manually, or use
to create preset-based settings.
A new asset writer input.
If you’re appending samples that are already in an acceptable compressed format, pass a value of

for the output settings to pass the buffers to the output unaltered. However, if you’re not writing to a QuickTime movie file, an asset writer only supports passing through a restricted set of media types and subtypes. To pass through media data to files with a type other than
, pass a nonnull format hint using the
instead.
You must fully specify the audio settings dictionary when using this initializer, which means you must provide values for the following keys:
. The identifier of the audio format. For
format, you must include values for all relevant keys with a
prefix, and for
, you must specify a value for
. The sample rate of the audio. Common values are
and
. If no other channel layout information is available, specifying a value of
results in mono output and a value of
results in stereo output. If
specifies a channel count greater than
, the dictionary must also specify a value for
The system doesn’t support specifying a value for
in audio output settings.
A video output settings dictionary must request a compressed video format, which means that the value you specify must follow the rules for compressed video output.
You must fully specify the video settings dictionary when using this initializer, which means you must provide values for the following keys
Specifying a
value of
results in an error.

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that appends media samples to a track in an asset writer’s output file.
Returns a new input to append sample buffers of the specified type to the output file.
Returns a new input that appends sample buffers of the specified type and format hint to the output file.
Creates an input to append sample buffers of the specified type to the output file.
Creates an input that appends sample buffers of the specified type and format hint to the output file.
The UTI for the QuickTime movie file format.
An identifier for various media types.
An object that builds audio and video output settings dictionaries.
A key to access the name of the codec for compressing video.
A key to access the height of the video in pixels.
The string identifier for scaling a video to fit the surrounding view’s dimensions.
A key to retrieve the video scaling mode from a dictionary.
A key to access the width of the video in pixels.
An integer value that represents the format of the audio data.
An integer value that represents the number of channels.
An integer value that represents the audio quality for conversion.
A floating point value that represents the sample rate, in hertz.
A key that specifies the Apple Lossless codec, and uses flags to indicate the bit depth of the source material.
A key that specifies the linear PCM codec, and uses the standard flags.
